Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Urechistachykinin I (UI, neuropeptide, natural AMPs; marine worms, Echiura, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1c, XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: edible fat innkeeper worm or the penis fish,Urechis unicinctus

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram+ bacteria S. mutants (MIC 21.3 uM), S. aureus (MIC 42.5 uM), and E. faecium (MIC 21.3 uM) and gram- bacteria E. coli O-157 (MIC 10.6 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 21.3 uM), and V. vulnificus (MIC 42.5 uM) and fungi C. albicans (MIC 42.5 uM), T. beigelii (MIC 21.3 uM), M. furfur (MIC 42.5 uM).Toxicity: zero hemo.lytic at 100 uM (cf. melittin 100% hemolysis at 6.25 uM).MOA:fungi:  probably membrane disruption. urechistachykinin I-induced ferroptosis-like death in V. vulnificus is dependent on ROS production (Han and Lee, 2023). Urechistachykinin I treatment induced ferroptosis-like death in S. cerevisiae via mitochondrial dysfunction (Han and Lee, 2024). Updated 7/2021; PubMed link fixed 12/2022; 10/2023: Jan2024.
Literature Information.Author: Sung WS, Park SH, Lee DG2008
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial effect and membrane-active mechanism of Urechistachykinins, neuropeptides derived from Urechis unicinctus.
